result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James L Cowell

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM Defendant James L Cowell appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for James L Cowell.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22TR1247 tracking with 22CF119:
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint and the amended criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Gumz waives the time limts for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.  

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Defendant James L Cowell appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant asks for an extension so he can get counsel.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued
Court confirms address.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:44 PM Defendant James L Cowell appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court finds probable cause for the charge for Riverside purposes. Court confirms address.  Defendant doesn't have a phone right now.
Court advises the defendant to update the court when he gets one.
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and will be getting an Attorney.

Atty Juech requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant responds.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $750 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
